name: TownePlace Suites Los Angeles LAX/Manhattan Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a nice hotel. Clean and conveniently near LAX. We had a trailer with us, and there was room to park it, which was great. Easy freeway access. The breakfast was also pretty good, which was a nice surprise. The staff was super friendly and welcoming. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice location, clean hotel, good parking

reviews.text: Very good hotel near and inexpensive near Los Angeles Airport, free parking, free wifi, we had a 2 bedrooms suite, 1 Queen Bed in each bedroom, 1 bathroom, a livingroom and a kitchen (with a large refrigerator, 1 microwave, a dishwasher...) very convenient hotel. Staff very friendly. Hotel to recommend for families. Love it.
reviews.title: GOOD HOTEL

reviews.text: This was the first time I ever stayed at a TownPlace Suits. Checked in, no luggage cart to be found. I get to my room and its next to the Laundry room. The room was ok at best. Carpets needed to be cleaned or replaced. When we went to bed you could hear water running in that laundry room. We had to get a roll away bed because the sofa bed should not even be called a "bed". Then in the middle of the night we heard like a plane flying by. Well it was a trian and it was loud. We went down to have breakfest and it was very limited and no room to sit down. There was maybe 9 tables with 2 seats at each one. We had to retreat back to our room with our breakfest. When we left and checked out I was not asked how everything was. This is the worst experiance that I have ever had at a Marriott property.
reviews.title: Just Bad

reviews.text: The hotel could use some carpet cleaning, but the room were average and clean. The breakfast was only a cereal breakfast. toast and juice, it could really use some help. The bed was ok and relaxing, but the furniture was very use and a lot of wear and tear and needed to be changed out. Armrest missing materail on couch and chair. Internet kept droping off line and not a good wireless.
reviews.title: Average Night Stay

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week in Jan 2013 and it was a bad experience. The front office guy is not pleasant at all. He doesnt care about the welfare of the tenants. The housekeeping staff is shoddy and cannot do their job properly. For the amount they charge and considering its now owned by marriott..it was a bad experience. In comparison the Hilton property (homewood suites) they are amazing.
reviews.title: Bad experience

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 days as a stopover before flying back to Australia. Short to taxi ride to hotel from LAX. Then short walk to shops or train station. Nice walk to beach which was very very nice.
reviews.title: Short stay at Manhatten Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel had everything I needed and with a free breakfast, it made a very affordable stay. Really recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Average Experience, Aging, Weathered, Mediocre Hotel

reviews.text: My fiance and I checked into this hotel after a long day of travel around midnight. The exterior of the hotel is nicely done but that's all that is "nice" about this property. The check in experience was delayed after an already long day because the guest services person was challenging our rate (booked online).
reviews.title: Awful Experience at a Miserable Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel just feels like it is poorly operated. Well below the standard set by the Marriott brand. Carpets in hallways on the way to room had holes in it. The chair in the room had large chunks tearing away or missing altogether. The couch was dirty. The room just had an all around dated and dirty feeling to it.
reviews.title: Best all around feel at home location in Lost Angeles

reviews.text: Friendly check-in, large room with comfortable bed, clean bathroom. Free wifi, flat screen tv and kitchenette. The only downside to the room was the lounge chair, it was tattered and torn, looked like something one would pick up second hand at a thrift store. Couch seemed a bit worn and had lost some of it's color. Continental breakfast is provided, it's ok, nothing very special. Swimming pool available and free parking. It's less than a five minute walk to public transportation to the airport as the hotel does not offer a complimentary shuttle
reviews.title: Decent place to stay

reviews.text: My son and I booked a 2 bedroom suite with a friend and her daughter for 5 nights. We also traveled with a family of four who also booked a 2 bedroom suite for 6 nights. The first thing we noticed was the small size of the pool, which looked much larger in pictures. We entered the lobby which was smaller than my kitchen. Anthony at the front desk checked us in and we went up to our room on the 2nd floor. Well... the first thing we noticed was how dirty and stained the carpet was. The couch was so dirty and dingy, we were afraid to sit on it and were afraid to even open it up. The chair was worn and scratched. The kitchen and bathroom were in decent shape. The bathroom appeared to be updated. One bedroom was smaller than the other and did not have a television. The air conditioner control in our friend's room was not working properly and Anthony came up to check it out. He was very apologetic and tried to help as best he could. He is probably the best asset the hotel has to offer. We kept our suitcases closed and off the floor that night. In the morning, we pulled the curtains open to discover a view of train tracks and commercial buildings. We had a quick breakfast of fruit, cereal and yogurt in a very small and cramped breakfast room. We had learned upon arrival that the hotel was "dog friendly", but were quite surprised to see one person walk 5 dogs through the lobby and outside. Seemed a bit excessive and left us wondering.... We then spent most of the first day of our vacation driving around town trying to find another hotel to stay at. The front desk graciously let us cancel the remainder of our reservation and we enjoyed our next four nights at the Manhattan Beach Marriott. Our friends came with us, as well as two other families who had reservations, but trusted our judgement.
reviews.title: Guest Beware

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel 5 days. We had a great experience, the staff was wonderful and the 2 bedroom suite was great...But, the carpet could use some cleaning. I was on the 2nd floor, when I stepped out of the elevator my first thought was "oh crap we are in a dump" which wasn't the case, the room was nice. First impression means a lot. Management, you really need to clean or replace the carpet. Several reviews mentioned the carpet as well. The hotel is in a great location, not far from the airport and within walking distance to several stores.
reviews.title: Nice Place...BUT

reviews.text: This hotel is a good location, easy access to 110 and 405. The rooms are a decent size, but a little cramped when the sofa bed is pulled out. (We had a queen bed, with a sofa sleeper for me, husband, 12 year old.) The room could use an extra mirror, as the only mirror in the whole place was in the bathroom. Plenty of storage, and having the full kitchen was nice when staying 5 nights.
reviews.title: Good location not far from LAX, met our needs

reviews.text: ROOM TIP: The hotel sits off a busy street - Aviation Blvd, with a commuter train running on the other side. The street noise was pretty bad, so we requested to be moved to the train side, which they were able to do for us after the 2nd day of our stay. That made a huge difference for a good night's sleep. Anthony at the front desk did a great job working that out for us.
reviews.title: Average hotel, close to LAX

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel back in 2008 and it was NOT fun then. Supposedly, they remodeled and improved this hotel (including their staff!) since then so, when our house flooded and we needed a place to stay, I thought I'd give them a 2nd chance. I figured that many of their problems would have been addressed, since they'd had so many negative reviews over the years. And, they're a Marriott, so they should have made improvements, right?
reviews.title: Gave them a second chance and boy do I regret it!
I did not enjoy my stay hear .

reviews.text: The room wasn't as bad as before. At least the noise wasn't a problem, in general.
reviews.title: Do not stay here!

reviews.text: BUT, there is still no one at this hotel who can properly enter debits and credits - no, wait, it's actually simpler than that - it's only addition and subtraction; basic math! We were there a little more than 3 weeks and I lost track of how many times I had to correct their errors. I even had to spend an hour on the phone with Marriott's corporate office, and THEY couldn't even get the Ops Mgr to comprehend how to correct her errors! After multiple calls and emails to Marriott corporate and the hotel's general manager, they FINALLY got the account straightened out, 2 days before we left. But then, when we checked out, ANOTHER error. Thankfully, my credit card company was on alert, and fixed the hotel's error.
reviews.title: Decent for the price but Marriott can do better

reviews.text: There were ants in the bathroom and kitchen and, despite several requests to have this addressed, they did NOTHING. The internet is painfully slow. Every time the train goes by the hotel, the satellite tv cuts out. But, that only happens about 30 times a day!
reviews.title: Family of 5 - met our needs just fine!

aka: Towneplace Suites Los Angeles Lax/Manhattan Beach Hotel
